cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses zero-knowledge authentication schemes, which are typically studied in the cryptography (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT) sub-categories. The use of semigroups and sets suggests a connection to discrete mathematics and algorithms, which are often studied in the data structures (cs.DS) and complexity theory (cs.CC) sub-categories. Finally, the use of graph isomorphism and colorability suggests a connection to machine learning and pattern recognition, which are often studied in the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
